summary: The document is a memorandum from May 1964, detailing the arrangements for a safehouse for an individual known as AMMUG-1, under the provisions of the President John F. Kennedy Assassination Records Act of 1992. It describes a verbal agreement with Ray Scoefield for the use of an apartment, deemed suitable for AMMUG-1, and outlines the steps for inventorying household equipment and moving AMMUG-1 into the apartment, pending the completion of debriefing by WD Staffers. The document also notes that Mr. Scoefield will inform Mr. John Ryan of the Safehouse Branch that further inquiries for apartments in the N.W. section of Washington are unnecessary.
key_findings: The document pertains to the secure housing arrangements for an individual linked to the JFK assassination records.
It highlights the procedural steps taken by CIA personnel to secure and prepare a safehouse.
The memorandum indicates coordination between different CIA branches and personnel, including Ray Scoefield and John Ryan.
The document is part of the records released under the JFK Assassination Records Act of 1992, suggesting its relevance to investigations into the assassination.
